From Wiktionary, the free dictionary

Asturian

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin cōnsīderāre.

Verb

[edit]

considerar (first-person singular indicative present considero, past participle consideráu)

  1. to consider
  2. to think highly of

Conjugation

[edit]
Conjugation of considerar
infinitive considerar
gerund considerando
past participle m consideráu, f considerada, n considerao, m pl consideraos, f pl consideraes
person first singular
yo 		second singular
tu 		third singular
él/elli 		first plural
nosotros/nós 		second plural
vosotros/vós 		third plural
ellos
indicative present considero consideres considera consideramos consideráis consideren
imperfect consideraba considerabes consideraba considerábemos, considerábamos considerabeis, considerabais consideraben
preterite consideré considerasti, consideresti consideró consideremos considerastis, considerestis consideraron
pluperfect considerare, considerara considerares, consideraras considerare, considerara consideráremos, consideráramos considerareis, considerarais consideraren, consideraran
future consideraré considerarás considerará consideraremos consideraréis considerarán
conditional consideraría consideraríes consideraría consideraríemos, consideraríamos consideraríeis, consideraríais consideraríen
subjunctive present considere consideres, consideras considere consideremos consideréis consideren, consideran
imperfect considerare, considerara considerares, consideraras considerare, considerara consideráremos, consideráramos considerareis, considerarais consideraren, consideraran
imperative — considera — — considerái —

Related terms

[edit]
  • considerable
  • consideración

Catalan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin cōnsīderāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): (Central) [kun.si.ðəˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Balearic) [kon.si.ðəˈɾa]
  • IPA(key): (Valencia) [kon.si.ðeˈɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Barcelona):(file)

Verb

[edit]

considerar (first-person singular present considero, first-person singular preterite considerí, past participle considerat); root stress: (Central, Valencia, Balearic) /e/

  1. to consider
  2. to think highly of

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of considerar (first conjugation)
infinitive considerar
gerund considerant
past participle masculine feminine
singular considerat considerada
plural considerats considerades
person singular plural
first second third first second third
indicative jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present considero consideres considera considerem considereu consideren
imperfect considerava consideraves considerava consideràvem consideràveu consideraven
future consideraré consideraràs considerarà considerarem considerareu consideraran
preterite considerí considerares considerà consideràrem consideràreu consideraren
conditional consideraria consideraries consideraria consideraríem consideraríeu considerarien
subjunctive jo tu ell/ella
vostè 		nosaltres
nós 		vosaltres
vós 		ells/elles
vostès
present consideri consideris consideri considerem considereu considerin
imperfect considerés consideressis considerés consideréssim consideréssiu consideressin
imperative — tu vostè nosaltres vosaltres
vós 		vostès
affirmative — considera consideri considerem considereu considerin
negative (no) — no consideris no consideri no considerem no considereu no considerin

Derived terms

[edit]
  • reconsiderar

Related terms

[edit]
  • considerable
  • consideració

Further reading

[edit]
  • “considerar”, in Diccionari de la llengua catalana [Dictionary of the Catalan Language] (in Catalan), second edition, Institute of Catalan Studies [Catalan: Institut d'Estudis Catalans], April 2007
  • “considerar”, in Gran Diccionari de la Llengua Catalana, Grup Enciclopèdia Catalana, 2025
  • “considerar” in Diccionari normatiu valencià, Acadèmia Valenciana de la Llengua.
  • “considerar” in Diccionari català-valencià-balear, Antoni Maria Alcover and Francesc de Borja Moll, 1962.

Galician

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin cōnsīderāre.

Verb

[edit]

considerar (first-person singular present considero, first-person singular preterite considerei, past participle considerado)

  1. to consider

Interlingua

[edit]

Verb

[edit]

considerar

  1. to consider

Occitan

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Latin cōnsīderāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • Audio (Béarn):(file)

Verb

[edit]

considerar

  1. to consider

Conjugation

[edit]

This verb needs an inflection-table template.

Related terms

[edit]
  • consideracion

Portuguese

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

From Old Galician-Portuguese considerar, from Latin cōnsīderāre.

Pronunciation

[edit]
 
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kõ.si.deˈɾa(ʁ)/ [kõ.si.deˈɾa(h)]
  • (Brazil) IPA(key): /kõ.si.deˈɾa(ʁ)/ [kõ.si.deˈɾa(h)]
    • (São Paulo) IPA(key): /kõ.si.deˈɾa(ɾ)/
    • (Rio de Janeiro) IPA(key): /kõ.si.deˈɾa(ʁ)/ [kõ.si.deˈɾa(χ)]
    • (Southern Brazil) IPA(key): /kõ.si.deˈɾa(ɻ)/
 
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kõ.si.dɨˈɾaɾ/ [kõ.si.ðɨˈɾaɾ]
  • (Portugal) IPA(key): /kõ.si.dɨˈɾaɾ/ [kõ.si.ðɨˈɾaɾ]
    • (Southern Portugal) IPA(key): /kõ.si.dɨˈɾa.ɾi/ [kõ.si.ðɨˈɾa.ɾi]

  • Hyphenation: con‧si‧de‧rar

Verb

[edit]

considerar (first-person singular present considero, first-person singular preterite considerei, past participle considerado)

  1. (transitive) to consider
  2. (transitive) to think highly of

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of considerar (See Appendix:Portuguese verbs)

First-person
(eu) 		Second-person
(tu) 		Third-person
(ele / ela / você) 		First-person

2European Portuguese.

Spanish

[edit]

Etymology

[edit]

Borrowed from Latin cōnsīderāre. Cognate with English consider.

Pronunciation

[edit]
  • IPA(key): /konsideˈɾaɾ/ [kõn.si.ð̞eˈɾaɾ]
  • Audio (Venezuela):(file)
  • Rhymes: -aɾ
  • Syllabification: con‧si‧de‧rar

Verb

[edit]

considerar (first-person singular present considero, first-person singular preterite consideré, past participle considerado)

  1. to consider, to regard, to see, to look, to view
  2. to deem, to hold
  3. (reflexive) to judge, to estimate

Conjugation

[edit]
    Conjugation of considerar (See Appendix:Spanish verbs)
infinitive considerar
gerund considerando
past participle masculine feminine
singular considerado considerada
plural considerados consideradas
singular plural
1st person 2nd person 3rd person 1st person 2nd person 3rd person

vos 		él/ella/ello
usted 		nosotros
nosotras 		vosotros
vosotras 		ellos/ellas
ustedes

considerásvos 		considera consideramos consideráis consideran
imperfect consideraba considerabas consideraba considerábamos considerabais consideraban
preterite consideré consideraste consideró consideramos considerasteis consideraron
future consideraré considerarás considerará consideraremos consideraréis considerarán
conditional consideraría considerarías consideraría consideraríamos consideraríais considerarían

vos 		usted nosotros

vosotras 		ustedes
affirmative consideratú
considerávos 		considere consideremos considerad consideren
negative no consideres no considere no consideremos no consideréis no consideren

1Mostly obsolete, now mainly used in legal language.
2Argentine and Uruguayan voseo prefers the tú form for the present subjunctive.
